pullRequest.body:
left and right unitor functors for product of categories

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

The implementation is copying from the same file for the associator. I am not sure if the category "1" , i.e., `Discrete Punit` should take universe parameter or not, and if it should have some notation like U+1D7CF ùüè or something else.

nodes.body:
### PR summary [9f3684242a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13663/commits/9f3684242a13b603e02f56df4217fdb023ec6aa8)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ leftInverseUnitor`
`+ leftUnitor`
`+ leftUnitorEquivalence`
`+ leftUnitor_isEquivalence`
`+ rightInverseUnitor`
`+ rightUnitor`
`+ rightUnitorEquivalence`
`+ rightUnitor_isEquivalence`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

Thanks for the contribution! If you think this PR is ready for review please add the "awaiting-review" label. While you're at it, adding the "t-category-theory" tag also helps the discoverability of the PR. Also see [this page](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html) for more info.
@erdOne Thank you for the reply! Yeah I added the two tags and reading the doc now.
As the file is named `Associator.lean`, could you move the new code to a new file `Unitor.lean`.
@joelriou Thank you for the suggestion! New code moved to a new file `Unitor.lean`.
You may have to update the root file `Mathlib.lean` so that all files (including the new one) are imported.
@joelriou Thanks for the reminding! `Mathlib.lean` updated too. It's kind of weird that the ci pipline failed now though
checking the last failed pipeline I saw that `lake exe mk_all --lib Mathlib` generates `Mathlib.lean` in alphabet order. Now updating it again all checks have passed.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9634960928/job/26571224196)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9634960928/job/26571224325)

Untested, but the following syntax is better:
```suggestion
  map f := f.2
```

The following name would be clearer:
```suggestion
def leftUnitorEquivalence : Discrete PUnit √ó C ‚âå C :=
```
Instead of `eqToIso`, have you tried `Iso.refl _`? It should work for at least some of the isomorphisms.

Also, why not use the `where` syntax:
```lean
def leftUnitorEquivalence : Discrete PUnit √ó C ‚âå C where
  functor := ...
  inverse := ...
  unitIso := ...
  counitIso := ...
```
That would be 4 lines of code instead of 2, but this is much clearer IMHO.
I copied the impl of associator. Let me try to change to the cleaner impl
Hi this 4 lines version works! I push it with a new commit.

Untested, but you may use the recent additions `Equivalence.isEquivalence_functor/inverse`:
```suggestion
  (leftUnitorEquivalence C).isEquivalence_functor
```
Yeah this work too! Much clearer.
Hi I added the awaiting-review label back for the new commit. Please help review if possible. Thank you in advance!

For one-liners, this is the preferred style.
```suggestion
/-- The left unitor functor `1 √ó C ‚•§ C` -/
```
Yeah all one-line doc updated.

```suggestion
@[simps]
def leftUnitorEquivalence : Discrete PUnit √ó C ‚âå C where
```
two `@[simp]` for `leftUnitorEquivalence` and `rightUnitorEquivalence` added.

`IsEquivalence` is now a Prop, so that the naming convention would be:
```suggestion
instance leftUnitor_isEquivalence : (leftUnitor C).IsEquivalence :=
```
changed the two instances with the naming convention too.

```suggestion
/-!
# The left/right unitor equivalences `1 √ó C ‚âå C` and `C √ó 1 ‚âå C`.

-/
```
Thanks! The style for doc of a file updated too

As there is an implicit universe, it would be nice that it appears as the first, so that `universe v u` should be replaced by `universe w v u`, and the definitions changed as follows:
```suggestion
def leftUnitor : Discrete (PUnit : Type w) √ó C ‚•§ C where
```
Thanks! The implicit universe parameter is updated as suggest. I saw that there are styles like `PUnit.{w+1}` in mathlib. Will it be better using this style here?
I feel it does not matter very much.

And similarly below:
```suggestion
def leftUnitor : Discrete (PUnit : Type w) √ó C ‚•§ C where
```
Thanks! Codestyle change with space before column now

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add unitor functor for product of categories
